If I go west first, I'll enter a new room, say the Pantry maybe? From there, my options might be to go north, east, or south again. If I then decide to go south from the Pantry, that could take me somewhere like the Utility Room. Then from the Utility Room, perhaps going north back into the main corridor, or west into another room.

Alternatively, if I start by going south from the Laundry Room, that might lead me into a Basement area. From there, moving east or west could open up new spaces. But basements can sometimes trap you because of limited exits, so maybe it's better to explore the upper floors first.

I also need to think about how each room's layout connects. Maybe after visiting the Pantry and Utility Room via the western path, I might end up in a dead end or have all rooms explored. Similarly, going south might lead me into more rooms before needing to backtrack.

To minimize the number of changes, I should plan a route that covers as many rooms as possible without having to turn back. So perhaps the best approach is to start west and then continue exploring from there, ensuring that each step leads to a new room until all are covered.
